a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Proportion of youth and adults with ICT skills, male vs. female,
The proportion of youth and adults with information and communications technology (ICT) skills, by type of skill as defined as the
percentage of youth (aged 15-24 years) and adults (aged 15 years and above) that have undertaken certain computer-related
activities in a given time period. In this case, it is measured as the share of youth and adults who have skills in creating electronic
Data source: Data from multiple sources compiled by the UN
